7298.name: Prototype Exporter
7298.description:
Take your prototype out of Figma. Download and run it in a browser on any device. You can use it offline when you're on the road or host it on an (internal) server.

HOW DO I USE IT?
Once you've installed the plugin:
1. Use Figma to design and create a prototype
2. Select the prototype's Starting Frame
3. Open Prototype Exporter
4. Click "Download prototype" to download a .zip file
5. Unzip & open index.html in your (user's) favorite browser!

The downloaded prototype is a series of images with an HTML file that will show you the pages + clickable area.

SUPPORTED FEATURES
Currently supported:
- Interaction: On Click → Navigate to Frame
- Cursor becomes a pointer on hover
- Optional 2x retina image export

NOT yet supported:
- Fix position when scrolling: layers will not be fixed, each frame is exported as an image
- Interaction: any other than "On Click" will not work correctly
- Animations are currently ignored (everything is an "Instant" animation)
- Preserve scroll position is ignored (click will navigate and scroll to top)
- Overlays do not work (mock them on your designs)
- Overflow behavior does not work (Use longer frames instead)
- Prototype Background color does not work

SHORTCURT IN THE DOWNLOADED PROTOTYPE
- R to restart the prototype
- H to Hide or Show the minimal interface

SPECIAL THANKS TO
Jack Galilee, Jacek Rzeniewicz for engineering support and Katy Jackson for product support
7298.release_notes: Prototype Exporter got an performance update! It will now only export your linked frames.

6571.name: Change Text to Layer Name
6571.description: A plugin that changes text to match the layer name. It also resets the layer name so that the text and layer name are in sync (i.e. changing the text will also change the layer name).

7663.name: Figma to Code (Tailwind, Flutter, SwiftUI)
7663.description:
Convert Figma layouts into responsive webpages (in Tailwind) or mobile apps (in Flutter and SwiftUI).

This plugin aims to raise the bar in "design to code" plugins by taking a new (and over-engineered) approach to optimize the layouts before the conversion even begins. If items are aligned, even if AutoLayout is off, it will internally consider them as an AutoLayout. Your project is always safe, as the plugin doesn't modify anything.

This project is also Open Source, well tested (over 98% in coverage), and expandable. Jetpack Compose is planned for soon, and other platforms are also welcome.

Feel free to say hi on Twitter or Reddit (@bernaferrari) and please tell me what you love, your ideas, suggestions, or show me what you have made with it!
7663.release_notes: Improve SwiftUI handling with color on Rectangles and Ellipses, add LinearGradient to Flutter.

6649.name: Figma to Compose
6649.description:
(beta, code won't exactly match input)

Easily convert Figma designs directly to Kotlin code for Jetpack Compose. (Not affiliated with either of them)

Often times designs contain non-repeated distances, colours and proportions. Replicating these designs can be very tedious, and discrepancies in design and implementation can lead to "split realities".

Primarily, this is to cut out taking measurements, reduce design-implementation back and fourth and save time/energy even when the designer and implementer are the same person.

The code outputted may be pretty verbose, but each Figma Component creates a Jetpack Composable function, making the output very easy to refactor in small chunks.

Note: You need to be running the server (https://github.com/CaelumF/FigmaToCompose)

Please don't hesitate to create an issue or send me an email for anything that doesn't work or if there's a feature you'd like :)

6917.name: Context Switch
6917.description:
Manage content writing across your team’s product with multiple state using Airtable.

Context Switch lets people maintain the texting outside the Figma files and directly import the context into the text elements that need to update.

With Context Switch, your team can even maintain multiple state: internationalization: EN 🇺🇸, JP 🇯🇵, TW 🇹🇼... / condition: Normal 🙂, Deep Dive 👩🏻‍💻... at once! and the best of all, Designer control "when" to update the content and don't need to update content manually, plugin helps you do the works!
---
📌 We are still in alpha version, so be careful using it.
📌Support Image switching are on the roadmap.
📝 Setup Note: https://www.notion.so/Figma-Plugin-Context-Switch-Note-a6fe123a69474646b1be29123fb6703a
📧 Email me for any question: me@designtips.today

7811.name: Spell Inspector
7811.description:
Spell Inspector helps to accurately find and correct spelling errors for the English language. It will correct your typos and misused words in minutes.

The plugin checks the current Page for spelling errors and offers corresponding suggestions to correct them.

How to use it: 

1. Open your file
2. Run the Spell Inspector plugin from the menu -> Plugins -> Spell Inspector
3. Word, Occurrence Count, and Suggestion tags will be shown. By clicking on a particular word its position will be highlighted.
4. If you want to change all occurrences at the same time click on any of the suggestion tags.
5. And if you want to check out more suggestions or a custom replacement of words, click on the info icon where you can see each frame name or group name where the misspelled word is located. 
6. By clicking on the frame name, you will be redirected to word position in a particular frame.

Voila! Everything is checked and good to go!  

We hope this plugin becomes a useful tool for you. Let us know your feedback on devtools@logicwind.com

7090.name: React Figma
7090.description:
React Figma plugin helps you generate React Component code based on Figma design.

Features:
- Component index
- Define component
- Generate React component code
- Generate React storybook (NEW)

TODO:
- Make storybook code generation optional
- Add support for TypeScript

6600.name: Direct Link
6600.description:
Navigate to node by link from browser or app without file reload.

Create link to the node in Figma file, open plugin, put link to the input and hit "Go!".

6700.name: Truncate Lines
6700.description:
Limit the number of lines of text that appear in your designs.

Select one or more blocks of text, set the number lines you need, then just click apply.

If you select text that is part of a component or instance you can choose to apply it to the selection only or apply across all the instances to keep them consistent.

If you need the original text back just press reset and your original text will reappear.

Hopefully this plugin will become redundant in the near future but in the meantime you can save yourself a bit of time.

A guide for this plugin with a bit more detail can be found here: 
https://www.figma.com/proto/RcHcOXtweV1Jj6qpVdRRFY/Truncate-Lines-Plugin-Guide?node-id=1%3A19&viewport=258%2C313%2C0.07258520275354385&scaling=scale-down-width

6718.name: Hide Layer from Instances
6718.description:
Iterations always demand new additions to components. All of us have encountered cases where we need to add something to a component but don’t want that to show up in all the hundreds and thousands of existing instances. We finally end up creating a new component so that the existing work is not affected. This plugin solves this issue with a single click.

Follow these steps to hide a particular layer from all component instances
• Select the layer/group/frame that you want to hide from one of the instances of a component
• Select Hide Layers from Instances -> Hide
• The selected layer/group/frame will be hidden from all instances in the current page

Use the Force Hide option if the layer that you want to hide is part of a component that is nested in multiple other components and you want to hide the layer in all of them at once.
Eg.: If you want to hide a layer in an icon component that is already used in various other components like different state and sizes of buttons, then Hide option will just hide the layer in the selected state or size of the button. Whereas Force Hide will hide the layer in all the instances of all the components that this icon is used.

This plugin works only on instances and not on components
CAUTION: When using the Force Hide option. ensure that the name of the layer you are hiding is unique. If not, multiple layers may get hidden.

Feels too small a feature for a plugin? There is also a Scripter File for this that you can use. https://www.figma.com/community/file/858014268242545394/Hide-Layers-from-Instances

Do let us know if you want any additional features. We'll try adding it. Cheers! :)

7138.name: Colors to Code
7138.description:
This plugin converts color tokens to code.
It currently supports JSON, CSS and SCSS formats.

It makes the task of converting the color palette of your design system or design guidelines into code easier.

Note:
- Only SOLID Color is supported.
7138.release_notes: - BUGFIX: Error when the color style is not SOLID color

6706.name: Master Components Manager
6706.description:
Want to work on a project’s design, but don’t want to transfer the master components to a separate page each time you create them? Then Component Master Manager is for you!

Each of us begins the stage when we need to organize a design system, and the master components are scattered across frames, manually searching for them and transferring them to a separate page is another problem. Component Master Manager will do it for you.

How it works:
1. Select pages with master components
2. Choose where to move the master components (new page / existing)
3. You can select the sorting and grouping of the master components by prefix, specify the distance between elements for grouping.
4. If you do not want the master component to be transferred, specify “: ignore” at the end of the name
5. Click the “Make magic" button
6. Wait and enjoy the result.

In place of the master components, instances will be created, you will not lose a single element.

7100.name: Flows
7100.description:
Rapidly create flow charts, mind maps, diagrams, or user flows.

Without ever leaving Figma.

* Flows is a premium plugin, and requires a license to activate. Licenses can be purchased @ hellolayers.com/flows

-----

💠 Features
⛓️ Easily and rapidly connect any two layers.
➡️ Create flow charts, user flows, mind maps, and what ever diagram your heart desires.
💡 Intelligently named and placed flows allow for easy customization.

👤 User Guide
↪️ Select any two layers. They can be in different groups, layouts, or even entirely different frames.
↪️ Customize your terminals, line style and color.
↪️ Hit "Create flow" and watch the magic happen.

📚Flows Kit
↪️ Flows works best when used in conjunction with the Mind Map and Flows Kit, brought to you by Layers.

7083.name: Quick Thumbnail
7083.description:
Quick help to build a beautiful thumbnail!

How to use

Step 1. Choose a Twemoji you like.
Step 2. Choose a background color you like.
Step 3. Click "Done" button.
Step 4. We will create a "thumbnail" page, right click to set the frame as a thumbnail.

7320.name: Figma Tokens
7320.description:
Making design tokens a single source of truth for designers and developers using Figma.

Design tokens are an integral part of any design system. Start with Figma Styles, and go far beyond!

Edit your JSON file and use it to generate Color Styles based on its values. Bind your border radii and spacing units to values taken from Tokens.

This plugin creates Tokens inside your figma file/library. It will help to keep in sync all tokens and element properties.

Tokens we support now
- Colors
- Spacing
- Sizing
- Border Radius
- Opacity

Read more: https://blog.prototypr.io/making-design-tokens-a-single-source-of-truth-for-figma-tool-76618abdeb88

Coming soon:
- Decisions support: Split your tokens and your decisions and create compositions
- Typography support
- Sync your tokens to an external JSON - allowing you to use one Tokens source throughout all your files - used by your whole team
- Create a visual representation of your tokens with the click of a button
- Use your existing Figma designs as a basis for your tokens: Pull existing spacing units, borderRadii and Typography styles
- Export Tokens to various formats (SCSS, YML, JSON, etc)

This plugin is a collaboration between Jan Six and Abdul Wahid. It's open source! Feel free to contribute and raise suggestions at https://github.com/six7/figma-tokens
7320.release_notes: Added support of references (add $ in front of value to reference another token, for example $colors.red will reference "red" in colors)

7698.name: Select by Font
7698.description:
Figma’s Selection Color tool but for Fonts and Styles.

Easily view all the distinct fonts used in the current selection. Then, select all text nodes of a similar font. 

WHY THIS PLUGIN WILL CHANGE YOUR WORKFLOW
This plugin removes the pain of finding and selecting text nodes.

Designers relate a text node with its purpose - heading, caption, label, warning etc. A well crafted design system has font style names that match the purpose of the style. Thus, font types and style names are the best way to get to a text node. This plugin makes that possible.

In our beta testing, designers who use this plugin use it so often and after a while can’t imagine their workflow without it. The plugin is designed to be a narrow and vertical dialog so that it can be kept open while you are working on your designs.

HOW TO USE THE PLUGIN

STEP 1
Select a frame or a group of frames

STEP 2
Run the plugin to see the distinct list of fonts used in the selection

STEP 3
Click on the Font or Style Name to select ALL the text nodes that match that style.

STEP 4
If you make any changes to font or style, then refresh to update the font list.

COMING SOON
Cycle through text node selection
Auto refresh font list after changes are made
Spell check on text nodes

7540.name: Dimmer It!
7540.description:
A plugin to add a dimmer to your frame

Just select the frame you want to add dimmer, and run the plugin.

Update:
- Set dimmer color and opacity
- Save dimmer theme

---------
Future update:
- Explore dimmer theme / predefined set up
- Auto add dialog/pop-up
- Multi screen dimmer

8066.name: FigPug Profile Generator
8066.description:
Resize your profile and cover images for various social media apps in seconds. 

-> This plugin includes presets for the following social media:
• Twitter
• Instagram
• Facebook
• Tumblr 
• Slack
• Vimeo 
• Youtube
• Notion
• WeChat
• VK
• Custom Sizes

-> To use this plugin
1.  Install and run the “FigPug Profile Generator” plugin
2. Select your profile and cover images 
3. Confirm the images
4. Select the social media websites you’d like to generate for
5. Click the “generate” button
6. Export your images 

-> License
Upon install, you can access a selected number of social media presets. To access all of the social media presets, you will be asked to purchase a license. Your license will allow you to generate an unlimited amount of profiles. 

To purchase a license, please visit https://figpug.com

If you’ve discovered a bug or have any feature requests, please don’t hesitate to reach out: hello@figpug.com
8066.release_notes:
v 1.3 + patch

- Fixed a performance issue when large image is selected

6921.name: Iconly
6921.description:
a freebie set of 120+ essential icons. It has all the essential icons you're going to need in your project.
What's inside:
— 5 Styles (Light, Bold, Bulk, Two-tone, Broken)
— Fully vector
— Pixel Perfect
— Trendy

6929.name: Mini Canvas
6929.description:
Mini Canvas is an additional canvas to display your selected layer at 100% zoom. It’s primarily useful when designing icons so you don’t need to constantly zoom in and out. Additionally, you can “pin” a layer which becomes useful when pinning components. For example, you might pin a tab bar component, with several icon components inside. When making changes to any of the icon components, you’ll always see updates for the tab bar, making it easier to ensure all the icons feel balanced next to one another.  

Enjoy!

 Notes: 
- Updates to the canvas are only generated everytime your selection changes. If you have a pinned layer, you’ll need to deselect all layers to generate a new update.

7713.name: Stories by Freepik
7713.description:
Stories is the latest creation from Freepik, one of the main references in the free graphic resources market. Thousands of illustrated concepts, with editable colors and backgrounds, are available for download. All of them come in different styles, and can be animated too with the online editor. Visit Stories by Freepik and get started!

This plugin allows you to search for illustrations from Stories by Freepik’s database and insert them directly into your project. You can choose the style of the illustration, its global color and what kind of background you want to have. All in a few clicks!

Instructions:
1.   Run the Stories by Freepik plugin.
2.   Use the search bar to find an illustrated concept.
3.   Filter the results by style and then choose the desired color and background.
4.   Click the illustration to add it to your project and start editing!

7275.name: Table of Contents
7275.description:
Generate a table of contents for project automatically. 

Direct people to the pages in your project that matter the most. This plugin creates a new page and a new frame for you.

The goal:
* Help non-designers in your organization find the important pages in your file.
* Provide other designers context with links to important related documents.
* Help make all of your projects look consistent.

This plugin is also open source and available on github for teams. 

Automatic link support isn't available in the plugin yet but will be added if it's supported in the API from Figma in the future :)

8141.name: Toolabs Design System Manager
8141.description:
✦ Design Tokens, Theme Management and more...

Define or update design tokens in one single panel, right from Figma.
And, immediately see the changes cascading through your Figma design.

✦ Manage Figma Styles with DSM Plugin

Selected Figma items are grouped by their styles and listed in the Selection Tab of the plugin.
For each distinct style group, you can apply following actions to Figma items having this style :
    ➥ Create and attach to New Token for each single style
    ➥ Tokenize All styles
    ➥ Select and attach to an Existing Token
Or
    ➥ Select,
    ➥ Delete,
    ➥ Zoom to selected items with this style.

✦ Use Real Content in your designs

You can easily populate your design with real data from Content tab of DSM plugin.

When you click a data field on the plugin, all selected Figma layer items will be filled with relevant text or image data. You can also create custom data collections to be used as real content.

✦ Document your Design System

Build your design system documents with an easy to use editor like Medium.com.  Enhanced with design systems related customizable widgets!

✦ Design to Code

    ➥ Programmatically access to design tokens from GraphQL API, or
    ➥ Use Export Widgets in documentation to export design tokens in various formats, e.g. CSS, Less, Sass, JSON, YAML, Js, Swift or Android.

Learn more at :
➥ https://www.toolabs.com/plugins/figma/

🛠 Known Issues : Figma Plugin API does not allow to modify Team Library styles, because of this limitation, DSM design tokens can not be synced with team library styles.
8141.release_notes: Minor bug fixes and plugin ettings panel added.

7299.name: Bring yours Coolors pallet into Figma
7299.description: Bring your color pallet into figma by pasting Coolors.co URL

manifest.name: Bring your Coolors pallet into Figma

8103.name: Annotate it!
8103.description:
Annotate it! is a plugin to help you automate the process of annotating your designs for a smooth and effective developer handoff.

• Drag to reorder
• Markdown text for smart formatting
• Smart annotation marker placement
• Assign a color for various intents
• Update, Edit, Delete annotations and Annotate It! reorders your annotations automatically

—

How does it work?

• Select a frame on your figma page to add annotation to.
• Click Add New button to add an annotation.
• Select a color for your marker if you’d like to create annotations for different purposes.
• Click on the Trash-button to delete an annotation (the numbers will update auto-magically).
• You can also use markdown for formatting your annotation description:
**Bold**
_Italics_
Underlined
~Strikethrough~
- Unordered List
1. Ordered List
--- Divider 

—

The Plugin was Crafted & Designed by @sonaliagrawal, and Developed by @madebyfabian.

It's Open Source, so for contributing, please visit https://github.com/madebyfabian/figma-plugin-annotate-it/

—

If you have any ideas for features, issues or perhaps ways to improve the plugin, we would love to hear from you via the Feedback-Button inside the Plugin, via Twitter (@sonaliagrawal and @madebyfabian), via a Github Issue or via Email (annotate-it@uxtionary.com).

Made with ♥ in Dallas, Texas & Nuremberg, Germany.
8103.release_notes: Improvements on the smart initial placement of the Annotation Items Wrapper Frame

7674.name: Export PNG with Color Profile
7674.description:
A tool for exporting PNG with an embeded ICC profile such as Display P3.

How to use:

1) Make your selection
2) Apply 'Export' settings (it's the same as exporting assets normally without this plugin)
3) Check your selection whether Export settings include 'png'
4) Click 'Save' button
5) Select where to save the zipped file (or a single image file)
7674.release_notes: Fix bug when exporting a single png

7570.name: random-size
7570.description: Randomize width or height of selected layers

7507.name: GroupAndHide
7507.description: With GroupAndHide you can create groups to add any type of nodes (Frames, groups, shapes etc.) without breaking their position in the hierarchy tree, and then toggle visibility property for all the items inside a group.

7670.name: SamPonent
7670.description:
This is a simple Plugin that you can use to quickly change the element in your design.

To use it, you just need to pick a component, then replace other element by attach its instance.

Designed & developed by Sam Liu, from Huemen.

7452.name: Rectangle to Frame
7452.description:
A tiny plugin that allows you to turn rectangles into frames. 

⭐️ How it works:
Sometimes you create a rectangle as a background for something, and then you place some items on top and wish you created a frame in the first place. This plugin allows you to fix this mistake easily. Select a rectangle, then select the objects you want to place in the frame and run the plugin.

TL;DR: It works like auto layout creation but without auto layout.

7302.name: Palette Magic
7302.description:
Preview and automagically create colour palettes from just a single color.

Find harmonious combinations that work well in user interfaces or explore contrasting hues to make elements stand out.

See an instant preview of any single elements with a color fill and select which palette to create.

7330.name: Step by stepper
7330.description:
Create stepper components easily.

Choose the number of steps, the size of each circle, the direction, the space between the elements and more.

7903.name: Text node name to id
7903.description:
This plugin lets you append the id of all the selected text nodes to their names. The format will then be: 'TextNode<node-id=node.id>'. This action is reversible.
The plugin also lets you export the selected text nodes to your clipboard. If you choose 'Advanced export', you can add any prefix to your node ids. The export action will copy the node ids in an YAML format. It will also add the color, font style, and text decoration to the node.characters. The resulted text will be easily usable in html files. The plugin also formats multiline texts.

7486.name: Supernova DSM
7486.description:
Supernova’s Figma plugin brings Supernova Design System Manager into Figma so you can design with your team’s code-enabled design tokens and components in the design-code workflow. Maintain your design system universally across teams. No manual syncing required.

✓ Connect DesignOps to DevOps with our highly customizable code exporters and flexible build process integration

✓ Design system governance across large cross-functional teams — including developers 

✓ Ship products faster with seamless access and updates to your design system

✓ Reduce design and code debt with one easy code-linked design system manager for all your teams

Push the boundaries of product design — at lightspeed. 
Request access at Supernova.io

8114.name: Contrast
8114.description:
Contrast is the new way to inspect, collaborate, and build components from Figma designs. It's specifically built for teams like yours—remote, component-driven, and obsessed with speed.

Contrast for Figma lets you:

• Directly mirror your Figma files, pages, or frames in Contrast. They'll show up in Contrast's canvas—exactly how they look in Figma.

• Inspect spacing—not just redlines. Finally, you can view padding and margin in designs

- Review designs, leave feedback, and observe teammates in real-time (separately from your exploratory work in Figma).

• Seamlessly integrated with Slack and Linear (more integrations coming soon)

• And so much more!

7615.name: Text Line Height Fix
7615.description:
Text Line Height Fix 是一款调整文字行高的插件。它能够让设计图中不同字号的行高，和开发环境下对应字号所占字符框高度相匹配（Android字符框：textview、iOS字符框：UI Label）。解决设计图与开发环境在文字高度不一致的情况下，导致还原度差的问题。帮助开发人员实现更精准的设计稿还原。

使用：
-选中文字图层，点击设计图对应的设备按钮，即可完成行高的修复。
-特殊情况：如果需要将行高紧贴文字，即行高等于字号，可点击「text height」按钮实现。

注意：
-目前插件针对Android设计图，仅支持 10px-70px 的字号的行高修复，未来会拓展更多字号。iOS和 Text Height 可修复字号不限。
-建议使用中文常用UI字体（苹方、思源等）
-不建议多行文字使用行高修复。

感谢：
-Sketch 插件「Auto Fix iOS Text Line Height」作者 @Gis1on @Youngxkk。
-插件中使用的波纹效果来自 @GeekLiB 的 Material-Design-JS-Button
7615.release_notes: Fix the error that the plugin failed to open

7366.name: Bootstrap Icons
7366.description: Add icons from Bootstrap icon library directly as SVG in your Figma projects. Find the appropriate icon in the list of more than 1300 icons.

7560.name: Annotation
7560.description:
Annotation Time-Saver for you⚡️⚡️
simply select on any text or group elements to create annotations!

📌 Current support two type of annotation:
👉 Outline: a border annotation that tells whether the container's width / height should be fixed or dynamic expand.
👉 Spacing: spacing inside a group of elements, ignore children (for example the background) by rename the element's name as `$bg`
🚧 Flow: arrow connecting between two frame

📌 Roadmap
👉 Number indicator (value and unit) for spacing
👉 flow type of annotation
7560.release_notes:
Add label with unit feature
☑️checkbox to toggle label
📐input field for the unit (px / pt / fr...)

7586.name: Export Settings Helper
7586.description:
Automatic apply export settings for mobile and web assets and other useful tools to make your job more efficient.

- Apply exports for mobile app
- Apply exports for web
- Clear exports
- Select objects with export settings
- Select objects with visible slices
- Rename layers to snake_case

7640.name: Missing Fonts Finder
7640.description:
Find missing fonts text on all pages 🔠

You can find & select to "Missing Fonts" by TextNode.

7691.name: Matercolor
7691.description:
Generate Material Palettes and Styles for any color based on the latest Design Guidelines.

✨Key Features ✨

⭐ Add custom name to your palette. You can also override existing styles created using this plugin by referencing them by the name you gave them!

⭐ Click on the swatch to pick your color using the native color picker or through the universal eyedropper!

⭐ Generating Additional Palettes with Accents and Complementary Colors is just a checkbox away!

⭐ Create well-organised styles with detailed description of the color in all css-supported color spaces (hex, rgb, hsl and cymk)!

8071.name: Print for Figma
8071.description:
Create Print Documents in Figma 🖨️ 📄 📝
‎Easily setup frames that are sized properly for printing at specific DPIs.

Currently Supported Presets:
📃 A3, A4, A5, A6
📄 Letter (8.5x11), Half Letter, Legal, Ledger
📐 Custom Size

Currently Supported DPIs
- 72, 150, 300

⭐ How it Works ⭐
1. Choose the number of pages to create.
- Choose your DPI (72 dpi will result in frames that export to the exact size of the preset in inches/mm).
- Choose your preset (or enter custom dimensions).

Coming Soon:
- Support for bleeds, crop marks
- More presets.

Contact ben@ktz.dev with any suggestions :)
8071.release_notes:
- All documents are now created by using the blue "Create Document" button.

- The blue button will be disabled if the dimensions entered are empty or outside the min/max for that unit.

- When clicked, Presets now auto-fill the custom document panel - this allows users to see more details about the preset and customize the document name.

- "Coming Soon" options such as Bleeds have been temporarily hidden from the UI.

- Plugin UI width is now smaller, in favor of larger height.

8193.name: Connect
8193.description:
Mirror any screen to a any file and create global userflows without duplicating your content. Update them whenever you want.

-- Use cases --

1. Put together multiple screens from different files into a single one without duplicating your content. Screens get imported as images so they are not directly editable. This allows you to keep your source files organized and create global flows to present to PMs, POs, Stakeholders, etc. Screens keep connected by their Artboard name so you can update them whenever you need if there are any changes to the source files.

2. If creating device mockups you can mirror your screens to import images from your screens quickly without manually copy pasting them.

-- How to use --

1. Create a new file where you want to import all of your files.
2. Generate an access token from your Settings page under your profile name.
3. Copy the generated token.
4. Open the Connect plugin and paste your token.
5. You can now paste any file link you want to import.
6. Select the screens you want to import. You can search through them, or filter by pages.
7. Hit 'Mirror Selected' and that's it!

You can now use arrow plugins to connect your screens if you need to create a flow. If you make any changes to the original screens just import your file again and select the screens you want to overwrite. Keep in mind you need to name your artboards accordingly.

7727.name: Azerbaijani Lorem Generator
7727.description: Figma istifadəçiləri üçün Azərbaycan dilində lorem mətn yaradıcı xidməti

7652.name: MockFlow
7652.description:
Add MockFlow to Figma's design workflow to rapidly brainstorm UI ideas with its easy to use wireframing software.

Use this plugin:
 
* To import your design elements from Figma and use them as part of your UI wireframes

* Export finished wireframes from MockFlow without leaving Figma for a seemless design experience with your Team

* As a Whiteboard on top of Figma to discuss and review its projects

MockFlow provides advanced components like DataGrids, Arrow-Paths, Hand-drawn UI components and more...

7183.name: Deck - BETA
7183.description:
Deck is a free FIgma plugin that allows you to export Figma frames as editable PPTX slides. Since the format is PPTX, it can be opened using PowerPoint, Keynote & even as Google Slides file.

Now design your PowerPoint templates right in FIgma and convert it to a ppt in seconds. Utilize the real power of layer management to build beautiful templates and slides right in Right

Visit https://deck.is/guide to get started with Deck

Deck supports Text, Images & Basic shapes. Check out the supported features -> https://deck.is/list

For more information, visit https://deck.is

Version 0.5 Public BETA
Report any issues or bugs at our community forum 
https://spectrum.chat/deck

7604.name: Bibbble
7604.description:
Stuck with right UI/UX solution? Nothing seems to work?

Bibbble is UX/UI screenshot library handpicked from most popular websites.

Choose a type, pick a solution, and place screenshot on the canvas. Keep playing around until you find something that fits best your needs.

Bibbble helps you to:
+ find right layouts / UI & UX solutions for project
+ get inspiration from industry leaders
+ import high-quality screenshots within seconds
+ search design by specific keyword
+ REAL solutions from REAL websites

For inspiration & personal use only. All assets belongs to their original owners & cannot be used commercially.

7642.name: Figma Finder
7642.description:
Figma Finder is a launcher utility plugin.
It gives you quick access to all your essential things.

- Accessing pages, layers, views,  and much quickly 
- Browsing your figma’s Layers broad using keywords matching.

🚀Launcher feature

Add Frame: 
1. Select a frame you want to save to the launcher
2. Enter a name in the input field at the bottom of the plugin and press the Add button.

Add View 
1. Move to the position you want to save to the launcher.
2. Enter a name in the input field at the bottom of the plugin and press the Add button.

🔎Spotlight feature
- Enter a keyword in the search box, and the layers that match the keyword will be listed.
- When you select a search result item, you will be moved to the location of the layer of that item.

💫Feature requests or Questions
Just hit me on Web (https://okazu.co), via mail (hello@okazu.co)

7184.name: Figma-Low-Code
7184.description:
The Figma-Low-Code plugin allows you to render your Figma designs directly in Vue.js applications. 
With the plugin you can define that certain elements should be rendered as input elements, for instance text fields. Also, you can define callbacks that should be executed when the user clicks on an element.

Detailed documentaion can be found yat hour github page: https://github.com/KlausSchaefers/figma-low-code

7238.name: Get Palette
7238.description:
Get Palette helps you to create beautiful colour palettes using images. 

Colours are extracted from your image using the K-means method. You can simply select an image and run the plugin. Furthermore, you can choose the number of colours you want the plugin to extract (default number = 5). The range varies from 1 to 10. So, you can better customize the output.

Feel free to share your thoughts with us at-
mayansachan12@gmail.com

Version history
V 1.0 - 18th July 2020.
Colour extraction. Select the number of colours.

7212.name: Rotate Each
7212.description:
Select one or multiple objects and rotate them randomly around their center point. This plugin was inspired by the same feature in Adobe Illustrator. 

---

I will hopefully add a UI component in the future that lets you specify a range you want to rotate by.

7558.name: Text Search
7558.description:
Search for text within your design.

You have lots of frames in your design file and you are looking for a specific thing, but you don't know where in the file it is. You wish you could just search within the file.

This is what this plugin is for.

Have feedback? Found a bug? Send me a message!
https://yukot.typeform.com/to/RXwpJVvD

7286.name: Apply Current Background to All Pages
7286.description:
A tiny plugin that allows you to set all pages backgrounds to the same color as the current page. So if you want to change backgrounds on all pages, you can change just one and use this plugin to apply it to all other pages automatically.

Usage: Go to a page in the file, run the plugin, and the plugin will copy current page background to all other pages.

💖 The process of making this plugin was livestreamed:
https://youtu.be/2xHC5mz-To0

manifest.name: Apply Current Background to All Pages

8075.name: Convertify Figma to Sketch/XD
8075.description:
Convert and export your designs from Figma to Sketch or Adobe XD (BETA) with one click

— Features

• One-click, automatic conversion from Figma to Sketch or Adobe XD (BETA).
• Use instantly in Figma; no other websites, apps or APIs required.
• Converts each artboard (layer-by-layer) to a real .sketch or .xd file.
• Simple pages converted in seconds; larger pages in minutes.
• Converts almost all layer styles and properties (see below for details).
• Retains all your Figma export settings for every layer.
• Keeps your layer's visiblility/locked/expanded (etc) states.
• Download the exported .sketch or .xd file to your computer from Figma.

— To use Convertify

1. Install Convertify and run the plugin in your Figma file.
2. Switch to the page you would like to convert.
3. Click on your desired "Convert" button.
4. Wait for the conversion process to finish.
5. Download and enjoy your .sketch or .xd file!

For step-by-step video tutorials: 
• Convert Figma to Sketch - https://youtu.be/1zwE3xSJeas
• Convert Figma to Adobe XD - https://youtu.be/cGYU2jvnSs8

— Not Supported Yet

• Auto/smart layout properties
• Components -> Symbols
• Local/shared styles
• Prototype links

— Sketch/XD Missing Features

• Hiding parent artboards (in Sketch/XD)
• Rotated parent artboards (in Sketch/XD)
• Ellipsis with "arc" properties (in Sketch/XD)
• Mulitple fills/strokes on a layer (in XD)
• Vector layers that use corner radius (in XD)
• Strokes/fills applied to groups (in XD)
• Vertical alignment for text layers (in XD)
• Nested layer masks (in XD)

— Additional Notes

• There are some cases were you may need to click the "Missing Fonts" notification in Sketch and manually re-assign them if they're not currently installed on your computer.

• Groups in Sketch can't have backgrounds, so Convertify will add a background "rectangle" layer to visually emulate group backgrounds from your Figma design.

• Non-destructive image cropping isn't supported in Sketch, so Convertify will transform your cropped images from Figma to a "masked" Sketch group, retaining your full original image and emulating its visual crop.

• "Clip content" doesn't exist on group layers in Sketch, so Convertify will create a "mask" layer at the bottom of the group to visually emulate clipping for Figma frames with clipped content enabled.

• Vertically aligned text isn't supported in Adobe XD, so Convertify will attempt to emulate vertically aligned text (where possible) by offsetting the top position.

— Bug Reports

Convertify is pretty new (like a baby panda); so if you do notice an obvious bug, please get in touch and we'll try to publish a fix for it!

— License

After you've tried exporting your Figma designs with Convertify 10 times, you'll be asked to enter your license key. Your license key will allow you or your team to export an unlimited amount of Sketch or Adobe XD files using Convertify.

To purchase a license or to find out more, please visit https://figmaticapp.com/convertify/

7686.name: PixelsConvert
7686.description:
Get dimensions of parameters in different units based on the different screen density (in dpi). User can select one of the six (ldpi, mdpi, hdpi, xhdpi, xxhdpi, xxxhdpi) screen densities available, to get dimensions in five different units- px (pixels), dp or dip (density independent pixels), pt (points), mm (millimeters), in (inches).

Feedback/Suggestions are appreciated!

7524.name: Copy svg without outlineText
7524.description: Copy svg without outlineText to system's clipboard directly.

7487.name: Color Contrast Grid
7487.description: Make a grid of accessible color combinations from your document's paint colours

7510.name: Color Editor
7510.description:
- Recolor your artwork with just 1 click
- Convert all icons in colors which suit best with your design
- Change the base color of the entire selection
- Change intensity of color

Upcoming Features
- Set darkness of the color
- Apply color palette
- Support for gradient

8081.name: Screeener for Figma
8081.description:
Plugin to create mockups of your project's screens.
Inspired by the Screeener app.

Live demo:
https://twitter.com/EdgardKozlowski/status/1256263229602398208

7813.name: The Icon of - Icon set
7813.description:
Collection of 1100+ pixel perfect icons now available in Figma. Easier to find, easier to paste.

Full icon pack contains:
- 1100+ unique icons in 23 categories, now including corona related icons
- downloads available in .fig, .sketch, .xd, .studio, .ai, .png, .svg, .pdf, .iconjar, .woff
- ligatures supported in webfont
- free updates

Freebie is limited to 120 SVG icons

Feel free to contact us in case of any questions.
More at https://www.theiconof.com

7871.name: CSV Populate
7871.description:
Populate your CSV data to text layers and automatically generate new elements.

How it works

* Create or export a CSV file with your favorite tool and upload it
* Rename your text layers accordingly to your CSV headers with a "#" suffix where you want the data to be applied
* Select the top level of the element you want to clone and the plugin to  search for text layers
* Hit the Populate button

Supported objects

* Frames
* Groups
* Components
* Instances
* Text layers

Limitations

* The plugin currently only supports changes in text layers

7601.name: Export Icon Font
7601.description:
A tool for exporting icon font as TrueType font from vector icons.

How to use:

1) Make your selection (icons)
2) Add the font name
3) Click 'save' button
4) Save 'fontName.zip' file to proper position
5) Unzip and use fontName.ttf and fontNameConfig.json to apply icon font file to your projects

8006.name: Lineage
8006.description:
Visualize your component and style dependencies.

Lineage helps you understand how your design system is being used and how every change impacts your project.

To use: 
1. Select a frame/component 
2. Run Lineage
3. Explore the graph, click on your nodes and find details about their dependencies
4. (Optional) If you click on the "Show all instances" button, the graph will display every use of that specific style/component throughout your document

This is version 1.0, more to come.
Please, if you have any suggestion or issue, reach out on Twitter @lalomts

8043.name: Heroicons
8043.description:
A set of free MIT-licensed high-quality SVG icons for you to use in your web projects.

Icons by https://github.com/tailwindlabs

Suggestions? Please file an issue on GitHub:
https://github.com/deebov/heroicons-figma-plugin

8068.name: Calculator for Figma
8068.description: Use a simple calculator in Figma

8151.name: Max Line Length
8151.description:
Plugin that counts the maximum number of characters across all lines in a text box unlike other plugins that count all characters or words.

— How to use

1. Select one text layer
2. Run the plugin

Demo: https://twitter.com/alexeinars/status/1295838119657381890?s=20

Note: plugin doesn't support mixed fonts

Made with 🧡 & ✨.
Alex

7504.name: Hey Figma Speech Recognition
7504.description:
Let you insert a text from your voice using speech recognition. Click Open Voice > Start Speaking to start the speech recognition. Once finished, it will automagically add text into the plugin. Click add text to add it on the canvas.

How it works:

- It will open a new browser window, because Figma doesn't have permission for microphone.
- The web app will recognize your voice locally in your browser using webkit SpeechRecognition, so you need to use modern browser
- Lastly, it will send the text result back to the plugin via web socket

Supported language: English

7257.name: GitLab
7257.description:
The Official GitLab plugin to seamlessly upload your designs from Figma to GitLab issues.

Design is larger than designers. Design Management should involve the relevant stakeholders in the conversation on functionality, interaction, UX and much more. Now you can start those productive hand-off conversations over designs and source code in GitLab while keeping Figma connected to make any improvements. Collaborate seamlessly where the action happens with GitLab’s Figma plugin.

Note: this plugin is currently in Beta. At GitLab, we believe that everyone can contribute. If you’d like to request a feature or report a problem, create an issue or submit a merge request at https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab-figma-plugin.
7257.release_notes:
- Display a filterable list of issues that the you're assigned to in GitLab
- Minor UI tweaks

Read more: https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab-figma-plugin/-/releases/v1.0.0-beta.3
